Warning: another long post ahead. As I mentioned previously, I am a dog person, and not a cat person. But when I read about what Shangrila at the Fort Hotel did to the vaccinated, spayed/neutered, well-behaved and well-cared-for #CatsofBGC (in the dead of night on Feb. 14, Shangrila gathered the cats and had them exterminated by PestBusters!!! Then when they got caught, Shangrila LIED and said that their staff adopted half of the cats and relocated the rest. The public demanded for proof of life, and to this day,  Shangrila has been unable to show proof that the cats are alive and well. And to make matters worse, when thousands of people started leaving 1-star reviews on Shangrila's FB page, Shangrila not only deleted those reviews, they also maliciously reported the reviewers' accounts as spam so that they would be blocked out of their FB accounts!), my heart bleeds for these cats. They are PETS, not pests! I am absolutely disgusted by Shangrila's indifference, callousness, and complete lack of compassion, not only towards the beloved cats of BGC, but the sentiments of the public! I have always been a loyal patron of this hotel chain, but after Shangrila at the Fort's blatant act of animal cruelty, I will boycott this establishment. My Charlie is now 12 years old and is still the joy of my life together with Pipitaüê± and Deweyüê∂. She was rescued from the streets all the way from Bulacan. I say that cat lives matter. And that there is beauty beyond breed. There is more meaning to adopt or rescue a cat or dog as compared to buying from a pet store. I am speaking from experience. 
I am happy that there is a growing number of people who are already adopting and rescuing from the streets here in the Philippines. It‚Äôs such a norm in ‚Äúfirst‚Äù world countries like Australia. It is my dream that our country will also embrace this. Hoping it will start this lunar new year, ‚Äúthe year of the dog‚Äù. I say again, ‚ÄúCat Lives Matter‚Äù. I am hoping and praying that the missing #CatsofBGC be found. And that everyone will learn from this unfortunate event. 
1. Cats are not pests
2. There is already the Animal Welfare Act in the Philippines. RA 8485 with amended RA 10631 with emphasis to consequences when you violate this law. 
3. The most humane way of controlling cat [and dog] overpopulation is TNR. Contact Local Animal Welfare groups like CARA and PAWS for more information. 
4. As a result of TNR, these Spayed and Neutered Cats in the community will protect us from rodents, cockroaches, and snakes. They are the ‚Äúnatural‚Äù pest control. 
5. Education is still the answer. Ignorance is never an excuse, most specially to our Laws.

Back in Manila, animal welfare advocates and #catlovers are full of anger and sadness because about 30 community cats that live in the Park in BGC, across from #shangrilathefort were removed over time culminating their dissapearance just a day or two before valentines day. The carers and volunteers who feeds them on a daily basis noticed them missing. It was found out that the very 5 star Shangrilathefort rang #Pestsbustersphilippines to remove the cats, which was done secretly at nights! Cats are not pests and pestbusters have no right to remove the cats. After much outcry from the netizens and catloverd  it has made the local newspapers and tv and efforts have been carried out to find the #cats! The problem is the location given for relocations sitedhave been changing and shang has just now publicly apologised for their stupidity while pestbuster's office is closed and not taking calls. These cats have been fixed and vaccinated and released . CARA, non profit volunteer based org helped with getting these cats fixed. It is so sad to think what their fate has turned into! üåπWe can‚Äôt just wish for a happy ever after.... Visiting BGC yesterday was just not the same since the #shangrilafort Hotel decided to ‚Äòremove‚Äô the ever infamous @catsofbgc :( I will never understand how someone had the right to make this decision. I am obviously a cat lover, but I do understand that not everyone is; however I don‚Äôt know how you couldn‚Äôt get even a little smile from watching children feed the kittens or see them sleeping in the sun. They are not pests, like rats or cockroaches (which I may add will be seen a lot more now the cats are gone!) üíî
My heart hurts for how deflated and defeated the people who spend their time, money and energy on ensuring these cats were vaccinated, neutered and fed, must feel. They were a well looked after, clean and healthy colony. üêà It highlights the importance of education and how far we still have to go. Stand by the mission and values of organisations such as #Cara and #paws, as well as so many amazing individuals fighting for the same cause, to humanely reduce the stray cat population and animal cruelty in the PH. 
As a member of the public you may notice the loss of the cats and if you do.. you can help. A positive can come from such a terrible situation. You may feel you can‚Äôt do much, like many of us do, but even if you do one thing it‚Äôs better than nothing. Donate, take a cat to be TNR, foster or adopt. I speak from experience when I say I wish I did more - but I know I do what I can. Every act of kindness can have an ongoing affect on a cats life. There are still cats needing forever homes from BGC... You could give them a second chance. -

Moving forward we will make animal sensitivity training with CARA, mandatory for all operations personnel. Additionally we were not very communicative or collaborative with our local community. From here on out we will make  it a point to keep open lines of communication with the rest of our community, and let people know when we are doing something that could affect them. I want to share something about the #CatsofBGC issue that has been spreading fast. But first, let me introduce this place. .

It's located somewhere past The Heritage Park, left turn along Bayani Road. "PUSSY CATS' KINGDOM," the little blue made-up house said. This photo was taken when @bjanbernabe and I traveled by foot (morning "workout") last November 2017. Whoever set that up there, we have no idea. Wala namang naka-bantay. There was a note written that said, "Hindi iponan ng mga pusa. 'Wag maglagay ng maliliit na pusa, di pa kumakain." We found two cats finding shelter from the 9am heat. It's a cute and nice home for these stray cats, but not the best and proper one thay they can have.
.

The situation of the cats in BGC is almost the same story, except there's no blue made-up house. We were very fond of them, kaya lagi namin silang dinadaanan after our morning jogs. There was "Bungo," with his black markings on the face forming like a skull. This brown-streaked, playful cat I would've named Darth Invader (LOL; also coz it just invades private space). A pregnant cat that we haven't named yet (would've loved to name her Fiona coz that sounds like a pretty cat, doesn't it).
.

They are super friendly and they love receiving lambing from people who pass by. But they do not *really* belong there. They are all stray cats, roaming around someone else's property. I'm not defending Shangri-la's action. And that's not the point of this long post (thank you for reading up to this point btw). Maybe this issue puts light to the overwhelming number of stray cats. If you want to help out these cats (and more), please #AdoptNotShop. There are a lot of kindhearted groups and organizations that tend to stray cats until a parent decides to take them home (my friend @fatimoir handles @catsforadoptionph). A lot of street cats need shelter and love. Instead of burning down Shangri-La the Fort, take a lovely feline, or two, home. Go back to the root of the problem: they need shelter. Be their home. .

Side note: I LOVE cats but I can't take them home. Maybe when I finally live on my own.

Last Friday, some of the new (and very hard-to-catch!) #CatsOfBGC received something from CARA Welfare Philippines (@carawelfareph ) that will keep their lives happier, healthier and longer: the gift of spaying/neutering! 
See, spaying/neutering don't just prevent cats from breeding and further overpopulating. When you spay/neuter your kitty, you're preventing it from: acquiring diseases transmitted through mating with other cats, roaming and running away, fighting with other cats, AND spraying smelly urine/wailing like crazy!! Here are just some of the photos from the TNR (#TrapNeuterRelease) activity made possible by our wonderful friends from CARA. You can even see our spayed/neutered BGC kitties comforting their inexperienced friends! Truly, that afternoon was filled with love and compassion--from hoomans and kitties alike! 
Since 2000, CARA (Compassion And Responsibility for Animals) has been serving as a non-profit,non-government organization for animal lovers. You may help them save more lives through spaying/neutering by donating to their cause. Thank you, CARA! I am thankful that someone is taking care of them. He said he is relying to good people who give him catfoods, and even some good people also feeding them but not enough. 
Can you believe that there are 34 stray cats now in Bonifacio High Street, and they are already part of this beautiful community?! How awesome is that!

But then these cats needs help. If you happen to visit @bonifaciohighstreet , please bring some catfoods for them. They are loving creatures, and  part of our community. Also if someone out there have a good heart to help Mr. Ochi to get a job, please do. He have a good heart.

He have nothing, but still trying to give something for these cats. 
A person like him who have this great compassion is someone worth your time.

After meeting with our Property Management Office, our community cats whose stay has been threatened has decided to make them stay and live their peaceful lives. We showed them TNR programs done in places like Greenbelt, Serendra, Ateneo, BHS, etc. the advantages of spaying and neutering, how community cats can be natural pesticides in keeping rodents and roaches away, and of course reiterated the Animal Welfare Act. 
As a compromise, we have a designated feeding area so the babies don't liter around. Litterboxes will also be placed in strategic areas as well. 
I believe that cats can co-exist with humans, whether you love them or not. Let's make the world a better place for everyone. (Our neighborhood condo community cats have been spayed and neutered via @carawelfarephils and we do this in batches. Volunteer homeowners sponsor these from their own money. We also feed these cats and provide fresh water and we've been doing this for years). #TNR #spayandneuter #catsofmanila #catsofbgc #puspin
